body:
@ADHB 

What does 7.5.2 or 7.6.0 mean here? Do you mean 2.5.2 or 2.6.0?

This change is merged to master and will be released as part of 2.6.0 and 2.5.3 (if we release it).

I have labeled it as `doc-required`. @315157973 or @Anonymitaet can help add the documentation.

@Saswatibhoi I am suspecting the issues were related to your deployment. I have to understand how do you deploy the cluster to understand the problems. In your [previous comment](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/7055#issuecomment-635445303), I still don't know what did your deployment do. Did you spin up a new cluster? Or did you migrate from one old cluster to a new cluster?
@merlimat I think your comment is the reason why @horsteff made this change. It removes the usage of Path.

@sijie  Firstly, thank you for everything, :bow: .

/pulsar/data/bookkeeper/ledgers/current/locations are very small. Don't see any of the bookies with ledger/current/locations any larger than 50 MByte total dir and I have dbStorage_rocksDB_blockCacheSize set to 1 GB at the moment.

Happy to report that I changed:
dispatcherMaxReadBatchSize=10000

Saw mixed results of decent and extremely good.

Extremely good results such as:
```
03:26:05.111 [main] INFO  org.apache.pulsar.testclient.PerformanceReader - Read throughput: 243598.835  msg/s -- 2787.767 Mbit/s
03:26:15.111 [main] INFO  org.apache.pulsar.testclient.PerformanceReader - Read throughput: 242916.023  msg/s -- 2779.953 Mbit/s
03:26:25.112 [main] INFO  org.apache.pulsar.testclient.PerformanceReader - Read throughput: 241419.952  msg/s -- 2762.832 Mbit/s
03:26:35.112 [main] INFO  org.apache.pulsar.testclient.PerformanceReader - Read throughput: 236405.226  msg/s -- 2705.443 Mbit/s
```

The extremely good results are probably when the broker & bookie happen to be on the same node or all three, proxy, broker, and bookie happen to be on the same node.

Other results on different partitions (didn't record exactly), looked something like:
```
Read throughput: 100k  msg/s -- 1250 Mbit/s
```

This is probably when a proxy, broker and bookie are all on different nodes or at least the broker & bookie are on different nodes.

Still much better performance throughput off of EBS than before :+1: 

Thanks for everything :)
I meant 2.6.0 yes. Ok thanks for your answer .
ping @sijie Please help take a look at this PR again.
If no one else wanted to contribute for this issue, we can do it! @jiazhai @sijie
@dockerzhang, thanks for reporting this issue. current way  may be easier for user to config different components using different image
@dockerzhang, thanks for help on this issue. current way may be easier for user to config different components using different image

> 
> 
> @oneum72 Can you first try to disable pulsar-manager in your docker-compose file?

So I did tried the initial [docker-compose](https://gist.github.com/oneum72/72d1459c0eb65395c5936d5bcae3cc18) with pulsar-proxy:v2.5.2 and disabled pulsar-manager as you suggested and found out the following as already described [above](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/7047#issuecomment-635442506). I can provide additional info if required.
I have never contributed before, so I would definitely appreciate some help!

> @Saswatibhoi I am suspecting the issues were related to your deployment. I have to understand how do you deploy the cluster to understand the problems. In your [previous comment](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/7055#issuecomment-635445303), I still don't know what did your deployment do. Did you spin up a new cluster? Or did you migrate from one old cluster to a new cluster?

In our organization, our AMI expires every 3 months. So, every three months we are required to update our instances with a new AMI. In this deployment, we spinned up few new bookies with a new AMI, and decommissioned the old bookies with the process I have mentioned before.
ping @merlimat please help review this PR again.
ping @sijie Please help review this PR again.

@codelipenghui @zhanghaou  I think we should make a discussion, I hava already fixed this in my dev branch by adding a option `--bookkeeper-metadata-service-uri` some weeks ago, but I am not so sure it is appropriate. How about the proposal?

@dockerzhang: Currently the helm chart is designed to allow configuring different images for different components. This change breaks the flexibility. If you want to introduce a common image, that is fine. But we should also add the functionality to allow overwriting images for individual components.

Also, can you send the pull request to https://github.com/apache/pulsar-helm-chart.

@jiazhai @sijie If we build components image separately in the future,  it's the best way to configuring  components using different image.
pulsar has built all components in pulsar-all, and if we will still use it. i think it's better to make easy for configuration but not flexibility.

update the doc for the PR: https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/2954/files

right now, the doc is updated for master, once the doc is reviewed and approved, the docs will be updated to the previous releases (2.5.1, 2.5.2, 2.5.0, 2.4.2, 2.4.1, and 2.4.0 ).

This PR is for the issue 6282: https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/6282
Add schema contents to CPP and CGO client in the master repo. after the doc is reviewed and approved, will add it to the previous releases.
@vzhikserg do you want to fix the old versions of documentation as well?

@dockerzhang - I think it is not only about flexibility. It is more about operability in production. The problem of using one single image is - if you update the image and re-deploy the helm chart, you will trigger the updates on all components. For some of the components like zookeeper, you probably don't need to deploy it every time there is a new version.

> we spinned up few new bookies with a new AMI, and decommissioned the old bookies with the process I have mentioned before.

Okay. Then you need to run `bin/bookkeeper shell decommission` command to decommission people. "*Wait for 24 hours, as our max ttl is 24 hours." doesn't provide you the safe way to decomission bookies.
@ckdarby Glad that you have sorted things out.
I just rebased all the files and I can again see conflicts.. :-) please review so, I will rebase it again and merge it soon.
@merlimat can you rebase the pull request?
@codelipenghui I think the javadoc is already versioned. http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/client-libraries-java/
@codelipenghui  I have add tests for preciseTopicPublishRateLimite, and all check passed.  PTAL
ping @sijie please help review this PR again.

Looks there are too many unrelated changes. @Huanli-Meng could you please double-check?
And, if you want to rebase the master branch, you can use git push --force.
ping @merlimat please help review this PR again.
@codelipenghui , sorry, it's my mistake. i will close the PR and re-propose a PR.
close the PR and re-propose a PR.

Great work!
I interpreted the graph as a single EC2 instance, but it must have been the aggregate of all 13 instances.
Make sure to resize EC2 again to optimize cost.
move to 2.7.0 first since no update on this PR.
@wolfstudy since u r working on function security doc, could u pls take this issue into consideration? thanks
@PiotrJander Any update on this PR? I move this PR to 2.7.0 first. If there are any updates on this PR, I will move it back.
@heronr Could you please resolve the conflicts?
@diegosalvi Any updates on this PR? Move this PR to 2.7.0 and If there is any update, move it back.
@ltamber Could you please help resolve the conflicts?

> @lhotari Yes, the problem is related to batch index acknowledgment. We will advance merge #6052. I think this issue can be fixed by enabling batch index acknowledgment.

@codelipenghui  It seems that #6052 was merged to master, however there doesn't seem to be any new logic to properly handle negative acknowledgements when the message id is instance of BatchMessageIdImpl. Perhaps I missed it when I tried to find the way it's fixed.

This doc is updated for the Pulsar 2.4.0 released PR: https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/2954.

The doc is updated for the master right now. once it is reviewed and approved, it will be added to the previous releases.

@lhotari Thanks for your feedback. Looks #6052 just can avoid the acked messages in the batch message deliver to the consumer. We need to find a way to handle negative acknowledgment. We need to remove the message ID from the unack message tracker and send the redelivery request to the broker until all batch indexes of the batch message are processed(ack or negative ack).

This doc update is for issue : https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/6282

docs are updated to the master. once it is reviewed and approved, will added to previous releases.

> For the connectors I have developed a modified version of the influxdb2 connector and it has been really hard to get it to work.

Yes, the difference between sources or sinks and functions is that we need to introduce external dependencies to test, but this is usually difficult. So it looks like we don’t have an easy way to debug source or sink operations like a debug function.
@bsideup I have pushed a PR #7141 which based on sijie's comment https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/5278#issuecomment-578371324. Could you please help review the changes?
